textList.name: TEXT_START_AEA_CULT
textList.text: The Vampweeds are hardcore industrialists, capitalists, and democrats. The only truly democratic nation without a voice in the Federation, many Confederates have felt discriminated against and look to the Coalition as a solution. Expect to see as many hostiles as you do friendly faces.

The Gathering has long since been protesting against the Confederacy joining the Federation, but still Premier Ivar pushes for unification. With Confederates now divided between the Federation and the Coalition, this may be an unusual mix of allies and enemies for you.

Confederate sectors are some of the most industrialized in the galaxy. With most heavy manufacturing now done by the Vampweeds, the economy of these sectors is soaring and draws the attention of many merchants. Unfortunately, regional politics have drawn the attention of Coalition recruiters too. Keep a sharp eye out for friends and enemies.

event.name: GUARD_AEA_CULT_CRIMINAL
event.text: Something seems off here. Usually, the Vampweeds wouldn't mind a ship like yours too much, but now, you catch suspicious chatter on the guard ship.
It seems your track record has caught up to you. The guard's crew have heard enough of the crimes you've been committing, and they don't intend to let you into the sector!.

event.name: GUARD_AEA_CULT
event.text: The Confederate guard hails you, their captain reciting words as if it's the hundreth time today they've had to say them. "Welcome to the Confederacy. On behalf of Premier Ivar we welcome all visitors who come in peace. However, to ensure the stability and order of our sectors, we request that all military vessels such as yourself submit to a minor tax before entering."

choice.text: We refuse to pay the fee, fight your way through!.

event.text: You mute the ship and prepare for combat.
The Vampweed nods and combs over the scrap for a brief moment. "Very well. Security will let you through momentarily."

choice.text: Request a waver because of your mission.

event.text: The guard looks ashamed. "Uh... Premier, I do apologize! We weren't aware you were coming. You are... uh, quite unpredictable sometimes. The fee will be waived, of course." The guard blinks. "Please don't mention this to my superiors."
"Welcome, Ambassador. I hadn't been told that you had a conference in this sector. You may pass, free of charge."
The guard looks relieved to see a familiar face. "Welcome back, Doctor! You're always welcome within our borders. I'll waive the fee, of course. I hope your time here is productive."

choice.text: (Shell Scientist Crew) Explain that you have business in the area.

event.text: "Ah, a Scientist! We are always pleased to accept one of your number into our lovely sector. As usual, you're entitled to the discount. We hope your business goes well."
You mute the ship and prepare for combat.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Adv. Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv. Piloting) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.text: "Oh, a Cultivator is aboard? We can offer you a substantial discount. We hope your business goes well."
You mute the ship and prepare for combat.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Adv. Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv. Piloting) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.text: "So you have a countryman aboard? Very well, we will apply the standard discount."
You mute the ship and prepare for combat.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Adv. Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv. Piloting) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.
(Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Adv. Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv. Piloting) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.name: GUARD_AEA_CULT_WAVER_FAIL
event.text: "Why should I wave your fee? You are a Renegade, correct? If you are not aware, the Confederacy is not beholden to Federation laws, and frankly having people like you here is a liability. We should be charging you more, not less."

choice.text: Then we'll fight our way through!.

event.text: You mute the ship and prepare for combat.
The Vampweed nods and combs over the scrap for a brief moment. "Very well. Security will let you through momentarily."

The Vampweed scratches the long petals on their face with their vines. "As you are likely aware, the Confederacy is not beholden to Federation laws or jurisdiction. That said, I understand that your cause represents the best interests of everyone here. The Federation might not be our friend, but the Rebellion is more certainly our enemy. I will do you this one favor, but do not expect everyone to be so generous."

event.name: GUARD_AEA_CULT_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Confederate guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_AEA_CULT_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Confederate guard. Without crew on board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_AEA_CULT_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Confederate guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_AEA_CULT

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: "There was a time I might have sided with the Federation, but seeing the kind of barbarians it employs to 'enforce peace and prosperity' across the Multiverse has shown me! This is for all my fellow greenbloods you massacred on your way here to disturb the peace, scum!"

event.name: STOREEVENT_AEA_CULT_SPELLS
event.text: This beacon is an outpost and trade hub for the Cult of the bud. Theres a varied collection of spells here, you'll probably need to pickup a few cultists if you want to use them.
Multiple Orchids wave to customers, trying to get their attention, while curious shoppers of various species look about.
Looks like no one's eager in helping out the Orchids, though your attack sends the market into lockdown. No time to worry about that, you need to focus your sights on your new prey.

event.name: STORE_LOAD_AEA_CULT
event.text: Before you shop, you still have some time to do something else aboard the ship.

escape.text: They look like they don't want to fight. They are trying to escape.

event.name: TRANSPORT_AEA_CULT_LOOT

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: This beacon hosts a Cultist transport. It's safe to bet the ship is most likely carrying some special tech. If you can kill its crew, their cargo will be yours.

choice.text: Demand the surrender of their goods.

event.text: You prepare to secure their cargo by force.

choice.text: (Confederate Elite + Good Reputation) Talk to the transport.

event.text: Your crew speaks to the transport's captain, explaining the importance of your mission. The transport's captain seems to understand, but also mentions the cargo they're carrying is vital to their own nation. If you're willing to pay in compensation, they're willing to make an exception.
The transaction is done. With the looks of it, this piece of equipment might prove useful.
You prepare to secure their cargo by force.
The transport captain shrugs and continues on their way.
They stay outside your weapons range, and eventually jump away.

event.name: TRANSPORT_CAPTURE_AEA_CULT
event.text: The crew is dead, leaving you with the ship. Its cargo is yours for the taking. Aboard is the special tech you expected, which you bring back to your ship.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_AEA_CULT
textList.text: The vampweed captain salutes to his crew and accepts his fate. "At least I die a proud industrialist and democrat, and not a butcher for a corrupt bureaucracy! GLORY TO THE CONFEDERACY!"
Without any words, the Confederate vessel explodes. The possibly expensive factory cargo is jettisonned far out into the abyss out of reach, but at least you can scrap the debris.
"Noooo! I never even... got pollen on my pistil... Screw you, Renegade!"
With the death of this vessel, the workforce of the mighty Confederate economy is now a couple workers shorter.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_AEA_CULT
textList.text: The halls of the once lively vampweed vessel are now as silent as the living members of their Floral brethren. Perhaps there's something poetic to this, but you're here for scrap and not deeper meanings.
"I'm not a religious man, that's a greenleaf's thing... but when you're taking your last breath, it's a rather spiritual moment. God... I hope there isn't a hell..."

As you board the cultist vessel to scrap it, you find various propaganda and paraphernalia relating to the Coalition and the Confederacy. These guys were apparently radicals and nationalists, but in a court of law, you aren't sure that would hold as a defense on its own.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_AEA_CULT
textList.text: "Okay, okay! I've been hitting the liquor a bit hard and it made me act stupid. Maybe I have a problem. Look, if you spare me, I'll give you whatever I've got AND I promise I'll get help, okay? Deal?"

Out of breath, the vampweed captain's petals are a bit singed at the tips. "If the Federation... truly represents peace as it claims... then I hope you will find it in you to spare me... despite my mistakes here today."
"You can't kill me, I'm a valued member of the industrial work force! If I'm not there screwing the cap onto every Kardoche fertilizer bottle, then who else will?!"

The vampweed nods to you. "I... apologize for my rash behavior. I have made an ill decision in fighting you. This is the kind of behavior that caused the old war. I hope you have it in your heart to forgive me."

The Confederate captain falls to his knees, begging you for mercy. He apologizes on behalf of his entire species for their past mistakes and offers you all of this month's wages at his factory job in return for sparing him.

event.name: AEA_CULT_TEST_FIGHT
event.text: TEST.

destroyed.text: You've destroyed the Cultist vessel and gain access to the factory, you quickly loot it before moving on.

deadCrew.text: You've cleared out the cultist and gain access to the factory, you quickly loot it before moving on.

destroyed.text:
You've killed the whale.
You monster!.

event.name: DEFEAT_VAMPWEED_ELITE
event.text: You've managed to take down an elite cultist ship, and now the remains are yours to scrap.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Cultist ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

destroyed.text: You expected the Clansmen to surrender at least once, but they never did. Instead, your final blow rocks the ship, and you watch as it explodes...

deadCrew.text: You've successfully neutralised the Clan vessel, allowing you to board it to claim your spoils.
